title: Companies needs innovative ways to meet customer expectations
text:
8 September 2015 17:00 CET Companies needs innovative ways to meet customer expectations By GNA 
Accra, Sept. 8, GNA - Mr Soumya Saklani, Managing Director, Millward Brown Sub Saharan Africa, has tasked marketing companies to find innovative ways to meet customer needs and demand in the global business environment. 
He said companies also need to invest a lot in brand building to promote their businesses and focus on key marketing metrics like knowing their customer target market and brand health and media communications. 
Mr Saklani was speaking during an event organised by the Chartered Institute of Marketing Ghana (CIMG) on the theme: 'Resilient Marketing Metrics and Strategies for Effective Brand Growth,' in Accra. 
The CIMG in pursuit of its advocacy and training objectives organised the event to continuously provide professional development for its members. 
The event seeks to bring to the fore the ability to use marketing metrics effectively on the turbulent economic period and to gain understanding of the market environment for successful planning. 
Mr Saklani said understanding and influencing customer behaviour is key for promoting supper brands, adding that companies should make their brand visible and well distributed to customer accessibility. 
He said companies need to avoid over-reliance on price reduction, when they want to build a strong brand, indicating that they should know their market metrics. 
Mr Kwabena Agyekum, CIMG Executive Director, said the event was to create awareness among the business community of marketing metrics. 
He said branding is a strategic tool when used properly would help to promote businesses for economic development. 
He called business owners to take bold initiatives to enhance their brand equity, commending brands, who have invested in their branding process to grow their products.
